meta_description: Plan your visit to New Castle, Delaware and the New Castle Historical Society. Learn the history of New Castle, browse our collections or take a virtual tour. Host a private event in our historic  facilities.
hours_text:
#### PLAN YOUR VISIT

We can help you plan your visit to New Castle whether you have an hour, a day or a weekend! We have maps and self-guided tours, an orientation exhibit and film, and can help you find shopping and dining options while you're here!

## VISITOR INFORMATION

VISITOR CENTER

The Arsenal

​

January

CLOSED

​

February & March

Saturday, 9:30 am to 4:30 pm 

Sunday, 11:30 am to 4:30 pm 

​

April - December 28, 2025

Thursday - Saturday, 9:30 am to 4:30 pm 

Sunday, 11:30 am to 4:30 pm ​​

​

Closed New Year's Day, Easter Sunday, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, New Year's Eve

​

MUSEUMS

​

Amstel House & Dutch House

​

Open Weekends for Walk-In Tours April 5 through December 28, 2025

Saturday, 10 am to 4 pm (last tour starts at 3 pm)

Sunday, Noon to 4 pm (last tour starts at 3 pm)

Amstel House tours start on even hours. Dutch House tours start on odd hours. 

Group Tours (10+ people) available any day of the week by appointment (call for reservation, 302-322-2794)​​​

​

Closed New Year's Day, Easter Sunday, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, New Year's Eve

​​

Museum tickets available at the New Castle Visitor Center at the Arsenal, 30 Market Street

Adults: $8.50 for one house; $15.00 for both houses

Children (6-12): $4.00 for one house; $6:00 for both houses

Children (5 and under): Free

​

admission_text:
## MEMBERSHIP

Members of the New Castle Historical Society support us many ways! 

While annual membership dues provide financial support, our members 

are also among our most active program attendees, volunteers and advocates.

##### JOIN US!

MEMBERSHIP

New Castle Historical Society members support the organization through annual membership dues which are used for the daily operation of the organization, our museums and gardens, and our educational programming. In return, our members enjoy free access to our museums and discounts on many of our programs including lectures, workshops, and special events. Additionally, we create special members-only functions like exhibit preview nights or one-time lectures or programs. 

​

Some members eventually get more involved by volunteering, but it's not a requirement of membership. 

​

We offer five levels of membership (Individual, Household, Patron, 1651 Benefactor & New Castle Steward) with different benefits for each:

​

All members receive:

  * Unlimited free admission for members to the Amstel House & Dutch House

  * Reduced or free admission to popular events including demonstrations, walking tours, lectures and special exhibitions

  * 10% discount on purchases in our museum store at The Arsenal

  * An annual keepsake gift

  * Invitations to social events including the annual Garden Party, Fezziwig's Ball and exhibit openings

  * Free or reduced admission to certain Society events, including lectures and special exh...
collections_text:
#### THE NEW CASTLE HISTORICAL SOCIETY

### REAL. HISTORY.

[Take A Virtual Tour](https://www.newcastlehistory.org/tours)

##### DISCOVER THE PAST WITH US

##### HISTORY

Publications & Articles

We've made several of our books about New Castle history available for free!

[MORE >>](https://www.newcastlehistory.org/publications)

##### ARTIFACTS

Collections & Archives

Check out some of the highlights of the New Castle Historical Society's collections!

[MORE >>](https://www.newcastlehistory.org/collections)

##### EXHIBITIONS

Visit a Virtual Exhibit

We've adapted some of our history exhibits so you can enjoy them online!

[MORE >>](https://www.newcastlehistory.org/exhibitions)

##### EXPLORE OUR MUSEUMS

The New Castle Historical Society operates two historic house museums to share the history of our community - 

the c. 1690 Dutch House and the 1738 Amstel House. 

Both are open to the public for tours, programs and exhibitions throughout the year.​​

​

​

​

[Plan Your Visit](https://www.newcastlehistory.org/plan-your-visit)

[](https://www.newcastlehistory.org)

###### [THE DUTCH HOUSE](https://www.newcastlehistory.org)

Learn about life in this 17th century Dutch colony in one of New Castle's oldest remaining houses. Furnished with Dutch colonial antiques, the Dutch House offers a unique experience for visitors. 

​

[READ MORE >>](https://www.newcastlehistory.org/dutch-house)

[](https://www.newcastlehistory.org/amstel-house)
